result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruslan Y Zarbailov was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the Pick N Save in Brookfield and the WalMart in New Berlin. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
To perform 40 Hours of Community Service on each case as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.
Consecutive to: 16CM346

Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant Ruslan Y Zarbailov in court with attorney M Nicol Padway.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS JAIL (CREDIT - 0 days); consecutive to any other sentence).

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS; (probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Pick N Save in Brookfield and Walmart in New Berlin.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Perform 40 Hours Community Service per case. 
RESTITUTION:  zero

COURT COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Hearing on June 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
